review_blob:
Earthy flavor with decent but slightly over bitter hops, for the "style". Really amazing earthy flavor but ultimately just too much going on in this brew. The sour, whiskey, hops and wood is just kind of one too many. Also, out of a bottle, I feel this is quite over carbonated. Worth a try, but not a repeat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour from a 16z can. Nice amber color with a solid head and nice lacing. Clean hop aroma that eludes to the piney hops that lay ahead. Well balanced with a clean malt backbone. Citrus and pine hops are the star here, and star they do. 

Beer would be better with a bit more carbonation. I think the hops would pop a bit more and reduce the hot alcohol.  

Great brew, ABW. Keep em coming. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Austin Beerworks Heavy Machinery IPA Series #2: Double IPA

review_blob:
Beautiful color, nice head.  Great hop nose with a great blend of pine and citrus hops. Has a bit of an alcohol bite to add the malty background. Overall, well balanced and a great brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Easy drinking bier de garde. Very pretty amber color, pours crystal clear. Could be a bit funkier in my opinion. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice wheat / sort of hefe.  Old wheat aroma with bready and banana phenolics. However the name suggests a Berliner Weiss and this beer is not at all sour.  So low rating for you!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bright red color, white lacing, bright red pour. Big burst of cherry on the nose. Smooth, but could use a bit more sour/funk. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lots and lots of hops which is great. Interesting almost smokey flavor with a bit of spice. Think that is from the tettnang. Tastes of a campfire made of pine needles. Interesting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Looks like, smells like, tastes like the perfect IPA. Dry finish, lingering hops. Citrus, pine, slight floral, just a bit dank. Motherfu$&?r that is good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Lingering head. Aroma is surprisingly light. Taste is sweet at first followed by a resinous explosion. I love simcoe and this is a good beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep red. Beautiful for the style. Decent aroma. Tastes of aggressive hopping. Dank. Musty. Nice and bitter. Good finish. You can tell this is a big beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Refreshing brew. Could use a bit more sour IMO. Very well crafted for such an experiential beer. Well worth a shot. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Tart Lychee

review_blob:
Good tasting if a bit uninteresting. Also a bit over carbed. Good lawnmower beer.

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob:
It was ugly and gross.  No hops in this one, and it proves why that is a bad idea. Looked like hell as well. Nasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
